newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish NBP again buys dollars.
newsitem.headline: Polish NBP again buys dollars.

text.p: The National Bank of Poland (NBP) again bought dollars on the interbank market, this time at 3.1555 zlotys, dealers said.

The intervention, described as "medium", came at 0950 GMT when the zloty was at 2.59 percent from the average weighted fixed dollar and mark parity rates for today -- the centre of the daily 14-percent trading band.
It was at 2.46 percent from the floating parity rate, which changes with dollar/mark moves on world markets.
Earlier the NBP bought dollars at 3.1549 zlotys.
